data.title: Quick Service
data.text: This is a casual place with good food and fast service. The restaurant's menu was different from the one online, and I wasn't able to get what I wanted to order originally, but it was okay. I ended up with malai kofta and it was good, just spicier than I expected. It's worth a visit for some decent Indian food. I think they probably do most their business at lunch because I noticed the sign for a lunch buffet they do.

data.title: Very good meal, no ambience
data.text:
We stumbled across Spice of India when our original chosen dinner spot turned out to be closed.  This is not a place to visit if you want soft lights, wall hangings, and sitar music.  But if you want a fine Indian dinner for a quite reasonable cost you should check the place out.  We had channa saag and it was better than good.  But my top pick is the lowly vegetable samosa.  Subtle spices that don't announce themselves all at once, but instead surprise you as you chew.

Definitely worth a try.

data.title: Quiet at Dinner
data.text: We found this hotel by using google maps to see what was around us at the Hampton Inn & Suites. Wonderful tikka masala and my husband enjoyed his dish, although I forgot what it was called. The naan is delightful and perfectly crispy and fluffy. Wish we'd had time to go back for the buffet but we only had time for dinner here.

data.title: Not worth the money
data.text: Food too spicy even for the type of food it is! Definitely not a place I would return to. Price is not friendly either

data.title: Just so-so, nothing special
data.text: It's a very average-tasting Indian buffet, and decent for the price but with limited selection.  The butter chicken was really good and everything else was just average, but the rice was very dry, though.  If you're really looking for Indian food and have to get your fix, then it's worth a stop for a quick lunch.  But I'll probably pass next time.

data.title: Okay lunch buffet.
data.text:
We went here on a Saturday at noontime.    We were the second set of people to arrive, but it quickly filled up from attendees to a conference at the convention center.   A buffet with styrofoam plates and plastic utensils.    There were 3 types of rice, naan, eggplant fritters, 3 veggie "entrees", and 4 chicken dishes.  Plus salad and rice pudding.     There was a "drink cooler" to help yourself, and you had to ask for a pitcher of water and plastic cups.   Cost was $11.99 a person.

Much of the food was spicy, but not all.  The food was tasty.   They made sure to point out the butter chicken for children, as it was not very spicy.

They kept the buffet stocked pretty well while we were there.   

Cash only.

data.title: good Indian food
data.text: The food was very good and authentic. The tables were not clean though ( we are not high maintance, but just a remark,in case management is reading )

data.title: A gem in Downtown Richmond
data.text: Great food, nice atmosphere, even on a quiet week night.  Loved the curry and naan.  Service was excellent.

data.title: Good Food - Homely Taste
data.text:
Centrally located in downtown Richmond. Food was not very rich with creamy sauces as you may find in some Indian Restaurants.
Service was good.

data.title: Surprising gem downtown Richmond!
data.text: Great chicken korma and garlic nan for dinner tonight. Fresh and delicious. The physical place is nothing to get excited about but well worth the four block stroll from the convention center. Go!

data.title: Spicy!
data.text: Samosa's were very good, and the portions were huge for Indian food, with fresh taste, good spices. We ordered take out, so I can't comment on service.

data.title: Ok
data.text:
Just ok. The restaurant had a lunch buffet with an abundance of Chicken. Chicken curry, butter chicken, chicken biriyani, tandoori chicken.  

There is no wait service. 
Styrofoam plates and plastic utensils.  

Drink fridge you help yourself to.
Trash bin that you use after meal.

So why the tip jar? Don't know cause the patron does all the work :)

Food was tasty though.  I would have preferred another choice of meat.  Goat or lamb would have been nice.
